required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Registration Study of Robtic Laparoscopy Versus Laparoscopy Assisted Colon Cancer Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Registration Study of Robtic Laparoscopy Versus Laparoscopy Assisted Colon Cancer Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Hospital of Jilin University

clinical_study.source: The First Hospital of Jilin University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the clinical data of patients with colon cancer who received robotic or laparoscopic surgery, and to compare the short-term and long-term effects of robotic surgery in the treatment of colon cancer. To verify the safety and effectiveness of the corresponding surgical methods, and provide better guidance for the following clinical practice.

secondary_outcome.description: first exhaust, defecation time, restoring liquid diet, hospitalization days, etc.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University
